text:
Jennings is a city in Decatur County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 96 people lived there.
History.
The first post office at Jennings was created in 1874. The post office there was called Slab City until 1879.
Jennings was planned out in 1888. It was named after Warren Jennings, a landowner.
Jennings was on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
Jennings is at (39.680197, -100.293918). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 96 people, 50 households, and 30 families living in Jennings.
Education.
Jennings is part of USD 294 Oberlin.
